title: Orange Meringue Pie Recipe
description: A nice change from lemon meringue, the flavor comes from a generous amount of orange juice and orange zest as well as some segments of fresh orange.

Submitted by jowolf2 Updated on January 31, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 28 28 28 28 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 50 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust ¾ cup sugar ⅓ cup cornstarch 1 pinch salt 1 cup orange juice ½ cup lemon juice ¼ cup water 4 eggs, separated 4 tablespoons butter or margarine, cut into pieces 2 teaspoons grated orange zest ½ cup diced orange segments ½ cup white sugar ¼ teaspoon cream of tartar Directions Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Line pastry with aluminum foil and a layer of pie weights or dried beans. Bake in the preheated oven until edge of crust is golden, about 10 minutes. Carefully remove the foil and weights; bake about 5 minutes more. In a small saucepan, stir together the 3/4 cup sugar, 1/3 cup cornstarch, and salt. Mix in the orange juice, lemon juice, and water. Whisk in the egg yolks. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until thick and bubbly, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in butter and orange zest. If desired; stir in diced orange segments. Pour into prepared pie crust, cover with plastic wrap, and set aside to cool. When pie filling has cooled to room temperature, preheat oven and prepare meringue. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large glass or metal bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar and cream of tartar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites should form a sharp peak that holds its shape. Spread over pie, making sure the meringue completely covers the filling and meets the edges of the pie crust. Bake in preheated oven until meringue topping is golden brown, about 15 minutes. Add Your Photo Photos of Orange Meringue Pie 01 of 28 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 28 Photo by  kklowell 02/23/2023 This is a fantastic pie. I will admit to two minor changes though...I omitted the water and increased the orange juice to 1.25 cups. I made it this past Saturday as one of five pies that I took to a party. My "theme" for the pies was that they all had to be a flavor I had never had, or made, before... and orange fit the bill perfectly. I expected it to be "ok"... but it was head and shoulders above that mark! I made another today for the family and they loved it. Thank you for the recipe!Just came back to say that I made another one today...it's that good! This one is also delicious. I made another slight change though and cut the lemon juice to 1/3 cup.This pie is absolutely on the favorites list here! 03 of 28 Photo by  SandyDonut9651 07/28/2022 Absolutely scrumptious..Better than lemon meringue pie which I personally find a little to sharp 04 of 28 Photo by  Autumneyes 04/20/2021 I thought this was really good! I put the diced orange in it, but I think I would like it better without it. 05 of 28 Photo by  Marmast 04/18/2021 06 of 28 Photo by  dong 03/06/2021 07 of 28 Photo by  Brenna Rossi 01/18/2021 08 of 28 Photo by  Karen Frances 09/13/2020 Absolutely delicious made with blood oranges instead of regular oranges!!! 09 of 28 Photo by  Stan Inzer 05/16/2020 This was an easy recipe. This is the only meringue pie that I have ever made. For an old man, I am pretty proud of my endeavors. Oh and by the way, it was delicious!
